newsitem.title: FRANCE: French June unemployment rises to record 12.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: French June unemployment rises to record 12.6 pct.

text.p: June French unemployment rose 17,400 to a record 12.6 percent, based on current methods of calculation, the Labour Ministry said on Thursday.
The rise took the total number of people out of work to 3,130,900, the Labour Ministry said.
The unemployment rate, calculated on the basis of International Labour Organisation (ILO) norms, was 12.5 percent in May.
Though April's French unemployment figure hit a high of 12.8 percent, a different calculation method was used. So, based on current norms, 12.6 percent is a record.
The ministry said the number of people out of work rose by 0.6 percent compared to May. For people under 25 years old, the gain was 0.3 percent.
The rise in unemployment was 0.9 percent for men and 0.2 percent for women.
